Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:Scott Leehy on election night.jpg|thumb|right|250px|<font size=2>Scott Leehy and wife Charlynn on election night, 2006</font size=2>]]
 
'''Bernard Scott Leehy''' (born 1962) is a [[judge]] of the [[Louisiana]] Fourth Judicial District Court bench in [[Ouachita Parish|Ouachita]] and [[Morehouse Parish|Morehouse]] parishes. He was sworn into office on December 27, 2006. Leehy had been the [[Monroe, Louisiana|Monroe]] City Court judge since 1997. A [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]], he defeated the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] Jay Mitchell in the September 30, 2006, [[jungle primary]] for the seat being vacated by the retiring Judge [[Jimmy Dimos]]. Leehy polled 15,494 votes (56 percent) to Mitchell's 12,121 ballots (44 percent).
'''Bernard Scott Leehy''' (born 1962) is a [[judge]] of the [[Louisiana]] Fourth Judicial District Court bench in [[Ouachita Parish|Ouachita]] and [[Morehouse Parish|Morehouse]] parishes. He was sworn into office on December 27, 2006. Leehy had been the [[Monroe, Louisiana|Monroe]] City Court judge since 1997. A [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]], he defeated the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] Jay Mitchell in the September 30, 2006, [[jungle primary]] for the seat being vacated by the retiring Judge [[Jimmy Dimos]]. Leehy polled 15,494 votes (56 percent) to Mitchell's 12,121 ballots (44 percent).
